content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> be the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x equals, x plus y squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math> with initial condition <math alttext="f of 1 equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></math>. What is the approximation for <math alttext="f of 1.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> if Euler’s method is used, starting at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> with two steps of equal size?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
